abstract.p: Sylvia Fox letter on Neal Gabler's May 3 article cites concern about concentration of opinion-forming media in Time Warner hands

block.p: Neal Gabler (''Win Now, or Lose Forever,'' Op-Ed, May 3) writes that the Time Warner-Disney dispute is of great concern to those companies. Of greater concern to the public is the concentration of opinion-forming media -- television, cable, movies, the Internet and so on -- in the hands of one group.
This has the frightening potential of enabling one group to influence or even control the public's access to different viewpoints.
